main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in the Pacific Ocean in March 1952, involving glowing objects and smoke trails.
interesting points: An observer noted a 'Fiery Glow of Smoke' possibly linked to an explosion,Various sightings involved three dark objects with white smoke trails at altitudes between 10,000 and 15,000 feet,The objects were observed for periods of 4 to 5 minutes, A meteor explosion was suggested in one of the sightings, No photographs were taken during the observations.
sighted object: dark objects with white smoke trails
witness description: Aviation Cadet Howard G. Low and crew members from Kadena Air Base, Okinawa
